sliders.name: Autonomy
sliders.description: Level of independent decision-making (from fully human-directed to fully autonomous)

sliders.name: Decision Transparency
sliders.description: Degree to which the machine’s choices can be explained or audited

sliders.name: Loyalty Volatility
sliders.description: Likelihood that the machine will switch providers based on new data or performance signals

sections.name: Machine Role
sections.description: Function within ecosystem, decision authority, and acting on behalf of whom?

sections.name: Decision Drivers
sections.description: Logic used to make decisions: objectives, constraints, rulesets?

sections.name: Information Requirements
sections.description: What data is required? In what format and frequency?

sections.name: Trust Model
sections.description: How is trust evaluated? Verifiability, reputation, feedback?

sections.name: Transaction Pattern
sections.description: How does the machine convert, buy, renew, or escalate?

sections.name: Friction Points
sections.description: What causes the machine to abandon or fail?

sections.name: Loyalty Logic
sections.description: What keeps this machine coming back vs switching?

sections.name: Visibility Layer
sections.description: Is the machine’s decision exposed to a human? Level of explainability?

sections.name: Ecosystem Dependencies
sections.description: Which systems, APIs, or external data sources are involved?

sections.name: Business Impact
sections.description: What does success look like for this machine’s engagement?
